page.title: 16THE RABY ESTATE.
page.content:
The land in the north west of the block belongs to Lord Barnard and the Raby estate. All the buildings are{whitewashed. There are many local{legends explaining this. The most common of these is that{Lord Barnard}was lost in the mist and sought refuge in a farm house. Believing it to be one of his own he demanded his keep, only to discover that it was privately owned. To prevent such a mistake occurring again he ordered that all his buildings should be painted white.
{Authors:}Clare Jordison, Nikki Lowes, Louise Mosley, Clare Robinson, Ann Rowatt (Queen Elizabeth Sixth Form College, Darlington, County Durham).
